answers.answer: I remember hearing that years ago. I have heard every single example of genetics with diabetes of both types from the skipped generation to "nobody in my family" to parents, to siblings, etc. I think genetics and diabetes is complex. I absolutely would not be confident that the children won't get diabetes. Type 2 diabetes which previously affected only middle aged people has become much more common in overweight youth. I highly recommend she change her habits, not just for diabetes but for the myriad health problems that are impacted by excessive weight and poor eating and exercise habits.
My Father had Diabetes , his Mother had it and I have it also. I am just hoping my Son doesn,t end up being diagnosed with it now!Angie

question: Son became diabetic 30+ yo.  Daughter diabetic 40+ in addition to having SLE since she was about 20.  Maternal uncle diagnosed diabetes 40+.  Husband and myself not diabetic.   Have four grandchildren.  Oldest one is quite overweight for a young girl (16).  Daughter in law claims she is not worried about the children as she was told diabetes skips a generation.  Any truth to that?
title: diabetes skips a generation?
